instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.CHGR_BMON: What is CHGR_BMON? CHGR_BMON goes between the ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 that charges the battery & creates PPBUS_G3H and the SMC(system management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip) and provides current sensing information on battery charging to the SMC. If diagnostics reveal an off reading or failure with the charger current sense, this is a good place to start troubleshooting..
definitions.CHGR_AMON: What is CHGR_AMON? CHGR_AMON provides DC current sense information to the SMC(System management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip). It comes from the battery charging chip that controls the laptop charger, battery charging, and creation of PPBUS_G3H(ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip depending on the logic board part number and model). This is used for sensors. If a DC current sense sensor is reading off in diagnostics, this is a place to start looking. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> re boots on battery
threads.message:
Brown Liquid damage like coffee or Coca

Green Light OK
BIL Light OK
No picture
No chime
Fan spins OK  but spins to the Max speed
No CD drive Noise

Passed it in the UC: OK 
Reinstalled in the chassis with the screen: OK  Boots and works fine without battery
When replugging the battery it turns off and reboots during the loading bar around 75% and this with and without the charger plugged
I've let the battery fully charge over the night and tried :  NOK
Tried with a battery completely empty: OK
After charging it few minutes, the same issue: NOK
Removed the battery again: OK

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> re boots on battery
threads.message:
Where was the liquid spill?
Post voltage for pins 9 & 15 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
Does it enter to OSX with charger + battery, starting in SMC bypass mode?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> re boots on battery
threads.message:
@<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>

without battery:

9: <SIGNAL>CHGR_AMON</SIGNAL> : 0.300V
15: <SIGNAL>CHGR_BMON</SIGNAL>: 0.049V

With Battery:
9: <SIGNAL>CHGR_AMON</SIGNAL> : slowly rising to 1.13V
15: <SIGNAL>CHGR_BMON</SIGNAL>: 0.050V

The board is pulling 2.8A

After removing the charger the board stays ON.......Hummmm...........Fixed?
Fan runs a full speed

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> re boots on battery
threads.message: At the scope the SMC is talking to the battery throught <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> at <SIGNAL>BSA_SCL</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>BSA_SDA</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> re boots on battery
threads.message:
I think you can close this topic.
After re assembly everything together, The mbp is turning ON and stays ON with the battery, tested from 28% to 25% during around 10 minutes.

Strange because, the board was just resting during 2 months........sometimes Do NOT Rush.

Thanks
